essentialsList.title: Blockchain Privacy
essentialsList.body: Everything that anyone can see in the public bitcoin ledger is fair game for this section. Look into the shape of transactions coming from a particular coinjoin protocol or privacy wallet. Some coinjoin designs require a minimum amount of inputs to have a valid transaction while other designs have a fixed number of inputs and outputs for all their transactions. The number of transactions required to achieve a certain level of privacy should also be considered. Is there a minimum required amount to participate in a coinjoin transaction? Are amounts fixed or variable depending on the coinjoin round? All of these points are going to be used by block chain analysts who try to find insights by searching all bitcoin transactions. We’ll come back to all of these questions in the other sections below.
questions: How does the coinjoin protocol work in a nutshell?
How is toxic change dealt with?
